intro: Riedelia paniculata, commonly known as the panicle riedelia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to Central and South America, where it typically grows in moist, tropical environments. The plant is characterized by its upright habit and showy, branched inflorescences composed of small, pink to purple flowers. Its leaves are usually palmately lobed, and the plant can reach heights of up to 2 meters. Riedelia paniculata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive floral display.
